sentences.en: Even now quasi - theocracy dies hard.
sentences.cn: 今天,即使是“准神权”也难以轻易消逝.

sentences.en: Humanistic artists opposed asceticism with humanism, opposed theocracy with human rights.
sentences.cn: 人文主义艺术家以人文主义反对禁欲主义, 以人权反对神权,追求个性的自由、理性的至上和人性的全面发展是文艺复兴时期艺术大师们创作的共同特点.

sentences.en: Of or relating to or being a theocracy .
sentences.cn: 属于、关于或是神权政治的。

sentences.en: Shangzhou was an important period for the formation and development of theocracy.
sentences.cn: 商周时期是神权政治形成与发展的重要阶段。

sentences.en: The short-lived alliance served only to put a secular face on the theocracy in the making.
sentences.cn: 而此短命的联盟只是为给神权政治在缔造时带上世俗面具服务的。

sentences.en: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.cn: 这是继神权政治象形文字之后的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.en: With its inclination toward the secular affairs, Christianity developed an elaborate theory of theocracy.
sentences.cn: 基督教在由“出世”倾向朝“入世”倾向转变的过程中,提出了神权统治的思想体系.

words.tran_cn: 神政；神权政体；神治国（复数theocracies）

trans.tran_en: a social system or state controlled by religious leaders
